article_metadata.description: Ohio’s jobless rate keeps falling, recently hitting a 14-year low, but that rosy trend masks how the state continues to feel the pain of the Great Recession.?Thousands still struggle to find work, and when they do, the jobs often pay less than those lost during the economic downturn.?Ohio has a quarter of a million fewer jobs than at peak levels in 2000

og.title: Laboring to recover
